headline: CNN 10
subHeadline: CNN Goes Inside Gaza With The Israeli Military; New Concept of Self- Checkout Starts To Get Old; North Texas Elementary School Teacher Goes Viral After Mock Trip to Mexico. Aired 4-4:10a ET

utterances.speaker: ROBERTSON
utterances.sentences: Israel is facing massive international pressure over the destruction of homes, the shockingly high civilian death toll. And in thelast few days over it`s apparently heavy-handed tactics at hospitals.

utterances.speaker: HAGARI
utterances.sentences: We are searching the tunnel with the bulldozers to reveal the tunnels that we suspect that underneath the hospital.ROBERTSON (voice-over): As we finally reached the hospital, it is already getting dark. A huge hole has been blasted through the walls, into the basement. (On camera): Why is the hospital so damaged? We`ll talk -- why is the hospital so damage like this?

utterances.speaker: HAGARI
utterances.sentences: So I`ll explain. It`s an important question.

utterances.speaker: ROBERTSON
utterances.sentences: Yeah, it is.

utterances.speaker: HAGARI
utterances.sentences: We came to this hospital five days ago. There was still patients inside the hospital. We did not enter into the hospital.

utterances.speaker: ROBERTSON
utterances.sentences: He claims since then all patients were evacuated by hospital staff.

utterances.speaker: HAGARI
utterances.sentences: We assist this evacuation of course, to make it a safe pass for all the patients in the hospital. We do not know that the hospital is entirelyclear. We do not know. We only entered to this area, which was -- which was suspected because we are being fired.

utterances.speaker: ROBERTSON
utterances.sentences: Hagari leads us through a warren of basement corridors to this room.

utterances.speaker: HAGARI
utterances.sentences: This was the armory. OK. This was the Hamas armory.

utterances.speaker: ROBERTSON
utterances.sentences: Yeah.(Voice-over): He shows us a few rusting guns and some explosives. These guns alone have potentially huge implications for Gaza`s hospitals. And Israel`s apparent push to take control of them. (On camera): The International Committee for the Red Cross say that hospitals are given special protection under international humanitarian law in a time of war. But if militant store weapons there or use them as a base of fire, then that protection falls away. (Voice-over): In other rooms, he shows us a motorbike with a bullet hole in it that he suspects was used by Hamas attackers, October 7th. (On camera): But the hospital authorities said they have no knowledge of Hamas or other groups inside their hospitals. Is that possible?

utterances.speaker: HAGARI
utterances.sentences: I think it`s not possible for a hospital to have this kind of an infrastructure. We knew the terrorists were here. We knew --

utterances.speaker: ROBERTSON
utterances.sentences: How did you know?

utterances.speaker: HAGARI
utterances.sentences: We knew by intelligence and also we got some fire from this area.

utterances.speaker: ROBERTSON
utterances.sentences: From this area, this building?

utterances.speaker: HAGARI
utterances.sentences: From this area and we were right to fire because what we found an armory.

utterances.speaker: ROBERTSON
utterances.sentences: But so much damage all around here.

utterances.speaker: HAGARI
utterances.sentences: Yeah, there is damage all around here because Hamas made it impossible for us to fight them. They built all this infrastructure intunnels and in hospital around areas populated. ROBERTSON (voice-over): As we exit the hospital, it is already dark. (On camera): We`re just getting ready to leave right now. The firefights still going on, still intense bullets fired explosions going on up the street there. (Voice-over): This war and the controverses surrounding it far from resolved. (END VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: WIRE
utterances.sentences: Ten second trivia.In terms of sales, what is America`s largest retailer? Costco, Home Depot, Amazon, or Walmart? Your answer here is Walmart, topping the list almost doubling Amazon sales in 2022 with 600 billion. Who`s a fan of self-checkout outlines at your favorite retailer or grocery store? Some people love them. Some say I prefer a perfectly fine friendly human to help me with my purchases, please. Well, some major retailers are starting to say goodbye to self-checkout lines. The machines were first introduced in the 1980s becoming more widely used in the early 2000s as stores look to cut costs and higher fewer cashiers. Well it turns out that utilizing self-service stations are actually leading to greater losses than human cashiers. Whether it be from accidental customer errors or from intentional shoplifting. One study found incontrovertible proof that companies with self-checkout machines had a loss rate of about 4%. That`s more than double the industry average. Some attempts to fix these issues like adding weight sensors have only led to further customer frustration. So far Walmart, ShopRite, Costco and the U.K.`s boots have all started to dial back their self-checkout strategy. What do you say? Good idea or bad idea? Today`s story getting a 10 out of 10 highlights the power of imagination. You`ve often heard me say that if there`s something you want to achieve, you have to see it before you see it. Meaning you see it in your mind`s eye before you actually see it come to fruition. Well, first grade teacher, Ms. Sonja White at Trinity Leadership School in Texas, wanted to give her students an imaginary experience of taking a trip on an airplane. But what ended up happening was a dream come true. (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) JEANNE MOOS, CNN NATIONAL NEWS CORRESPONDENT (voice-over): Texas teacher, Sonja White staged a mock trip to Mexico for her students.

utterances.speaker: SONJA WHITE
utterances.sentences: I`m going to change my classroom into an airplane.

utterances.speaker: MOOS
utterances.sentences: The first graders at Trinity Leadership School flew Southwest airlines.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Where are you going?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Mexico.

utterances.speaker: MOOS
utterances.sentences: With their carryon luggage and even neck pillows.

utterances.speaker: WHITE
utterances.sentences: So now I`m a TSA agent.

utterances.speaker: MOOS
utterances.sentences: A video of takeoff set the move. Their teacher transformed into a flight attendant.

utterances.speaker: WHITE
utterances.sentences: Apple juice.

utterances.speaker: MOOS
utterances.sentences: After an apparently bumpy landing, look at this kid`s face. They arrived in Mexico.

utterances.speaker: WHITE
utterances.sentences: They are going through customs. I am now a customs agent.

utterances.speaker: MOOS
utterances.sentences: The trip went viral, got rave reviews, best teacher ever.(END VIDEOTAPE)
